byline.contributor: Jodi Rudoren reported from Jerusalem, and Diaa Hadid from Jerusalem and Ramallah, West Bank. Rami Nazzal contributed reporting from Bethlehem, West Bank; Jerusalem; and Ramallah; and Isabel Kershner from Jerusalem.
byline.original: By JODI RUDOREN and DIAA HADID

abstract: Violent clashes between Israelis and Palestinians continue as Israeli officials report five Hamas members confessed to killing Israeli couple while driving with their children in West Bank; Palestinian officials question swiftness of arrests compared to Israel's slow processing of recent case of Jewish extremists' fatal firebombing of Palestinian home.
lead_paragraph: The five Palestinian militants who were arrested had admitted responsibility for the fatal shooting of an Israeli couple inside their car.

headline.main: Israel Says 5 From Hamas Confess in Israeli Couple’s Killing
headline.print_headline: Five Hamas Members Confess in Killing of West Bank Settlers, Israel Says

snippet: The five Palestinian militants who were arrested had admitted responsibility for the fatal shooting of an Israeli couple inside their car.
